abstract: President Obama will use the current Congressional recess to appoint Richard Cordray to lead the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, a sharp challenge to Republican lawmakers who have fiercely fought the nomination, a senior administration official told The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: President Obama will use the current Congressional recess to appoint Richard Cordray to lead the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, a sharp challenge to Republican lawmakers who have fiercely fought the nomination, a senior administration official told The New York Times. While the bureau already could police banks, the appointment will now empower the agency to regulate payday lenders and other financial firms. Read more »

headline.main: Challenging Republicans, Obama to Appoint Cordray as Consumer Chief
